#summary Brief introduction to jsTree
#labels Featured

== The instance ==

_This is how you create an instance:_
{{{
   tree = new tree_component();
   tree.init($("#box"),{                // the first argument is the node to be filled with the tree
       data      : "path-to-data.xml", 
       xsl       : "nested.xsl",        // nested or flat (included)
       dflt      : "site_24",           // id of the default node to select
       languages : [ "en", "bg" ],      // languages if any - if not - omit
       move      : {                    // moving/sorting rules if not specified - no drag&drop
                 rules      : [
                                "folder after folder",
                                "folder before folder",
                                "folder inside folder"
                              ],
                 draggables : ["folder"]
            }
   });
}}}

== The data ==

The structure of the xml should be nested or flat (use xsl accordingly):

_Nested:_
{{{
<item id='node_1'>Node 1
   <item id='node_2'>Node 2</item>
   <item id='node_3'>Node 3
       <item id='node_4'>Node 4</item>
   </item>
</item>
}}}

_Flat:_
{{{
<item id='node_1' parent_id='0'>Node 1</item>
<item id='node_2' parent_id='node_1'>Node 2</item>
<item id='node_3' parent_id='node_1'>Node 3</item>
<item id='node_4' parent_id='node_3'>Node 4</item>
}}}
